Text: Black tern:  In some lights it can appear blue in the breeding season, hence the old English name "blue darr".

3:

Text: Black tern: The genus name is from Ancient Greek "khelidonios", "swallow-like", from "khelidon", "swallow": another old English name for the black tern is "carr (i.e. lake) swallow".

<Text: Black tern:  The species name is from Latin "niger" "shining black".>
